intro: Deinacanthon urbanianum, commonly known as the Urbanian thornplant, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, waxy texture, while its fruits are small, berry-like structures that contain several seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation in tropical ecosystems.
